## Overview

A Mass Driver is an electromagnetic gun that accelerates mirrors to Mercury's escape velocity (4.3 km/s) for orbital insertion and Dyson Swarm formation.

> **Theory and Scaling:**
>
> - [Mass Driver Theory](theory.qmd) - launch physics, efficiency, cryo-aluminum, known issues, lunar Mass Driver
> - [Scaling](scaling.qmd) - throughput, production growth, energy balance, robots

## Mass Driver Construction

Base parameters: 1 km track, 5 km/s, 1275g, 0.4 sec acceleration, 33 MW average power. Details: [MD Theory](theory.qmd).

### Main Components

| Component | Mass (1 km) | Material | Localization |
|-----------|-------------|----------|--------------|
| Tunnel frame | **~270 t** | Steel Fe-6%Mn | 100% local |
| Rails + coils + cooling | **~170 t** | Aluminum (cryo) | 100% local |

## Three Stages of Mass Driver Production

Mass Driver production is divided into three sequential stages:

### 1. Element Production (Materials -> Components)

Finished materials (Al/Fe/Si) are transformed into Mass Driver components.

**Three element production lines:**

- [Rail Production](elements/rails.qmd) - aluminum guides for acceleration
- [Coil Winding](elements/coils.qmd) - electromagnetic windings (cryo-aluminum)
- [Tunnel Frame](elements/frame.qmd) - 1 km steel frame

**Materials:** Al (500 t) + Fe (800 t) from [regolith processing](../materials/overview.qmd)

---

### 2. Track Assembly (Components -> Mass Driver)

Components are assembled into a finished 1 km Mass Driver (base configuration).

**Three final assembly lines:**

- [Track Assembly](assembly/track.qmd) - rail laying and coil mounting
- [Control Electronics](assembly/electronics.qmd) - control systems and sensors
- [Testing](assembly/testing.qmd) - functionality verification

**Assembly time:** ~3-4 months for the first Mass Driver, ~1-2 months for subsequent units (experience curve)

---

### 3. Operations

After commissioning, the Mass Driver operates at **600 launches/day**.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Launch cycle | 2-3 minutes |
| Launches per hour | 20-30 |
| Launches per day | **600** |
| Launches per year | **219,000** |

**Throughput:** 600 x 116 kg = **70 tons of mirrors/day** = **26,000 t/year**

## Material Balance

**Per 1 Mass Driver (base configuration 1 km, ~450 t):**

| Material | Mass | Source |
|----------|------|--------|
| Steel Fe-6%Mn | **~270 t** | [Regolith Processing](../materials/overview.qmd) |
| Aluminum (cryogenic) | **~170 t** | [Regolith Processing](../materials/overview.qmd) |
| Electronics | ~7 t | **Import from Earth** |

**Localization:** 98.5% by mass

**Material production time (1 km):**
- Al: 170 t / 42 t/day = **4 days**
- Fe: 270 t / 18 t/day = **15 days**

**TOTAL (1 km):** ~**15-20 days** for material accumulation + 5-7 days for assembly = **~25 days**

*When extended to 3 km: ~60 days (45 days Fe + 15 days assembly).

## Mass Driver Construction

### Stages (base configuration 1 km)

| Stage | Time | Robots |
|-------|------|--------|
| Site preparation | 3 days | 10 |
| Tunnel excavation (1 km) | 1 week | 20 Moles-M |
| Frame installation | 3-4 days | 15 Centaurs-M |
| Rail mounting | 2 days | 10 Centaurs-M |
| Coil winding | 3-4 days | 5 Centaurs-M |
| Electrical and electronics | 2 days | 8 Centaurs-M |
| Testing | 2 days | 3 Centaurs-M |
| **TOTAL (1 km)** | **~20-25 days** | peak 20 |

*When extended to 3 km: ~2-3 months.

**With experience:** With parallel construction of multiple Mass Drivers - possible reduction to **15-20 days**.

---

## Wear and Maintenance

### Wearing Parts (1 km track)

| Component | Service life | Replacement (1 MD/year) |
|-----------|--------------|-------------------------|
| Guide rails | 3-6 months | 100-130 t Al |
| Coil windings | 3-5 years | 10 t Al |
| Capacitors | 2-3 years | 20 t |
| Electronics | 5-10 years | 0.5 t (import) |

**Annual replacement consumption (1 km):** ~120-150 t Al + 0.5 t import

*For 3 km track: ~350 t Al + 0.5 t import.
